speaker: All
text_entry: SCENE III. Rome. A room in Marcius' house.

speaker: All
text_entry: Enter VOLUMNIA and VIRGILIA they set them down on two low stools, and sew

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: I pray you, daughter, sing; or express yourself in a

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: more comfortable sort: if my son were my husband, I

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: should freelier rejoice in that absence wherein he

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: won honour than in the embracements of his bed where

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: he would show most love. When yet he was but

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: tender-bodied and the only son of my womb, when

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: youth with comeliness plucked all gaze his way, when

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: for a day of kings' entreaties a mother should not

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: sell him an hour from her beholding, I, considering

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: how honour would become such a person. that it was

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: no better than picture-like to hang by the wall, if

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: renown made it not stir, was pleased to let him seek

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: danger where he was like to find fame. To a cruel

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: war I sent him; from whence he returned, his brows

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: bound with oak. I tell thee, daughter, I sprang not

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: more in joy at first hearing he was a man-child

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: than now in first seeing he had proved himself a

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: man.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: But had he died in the business, madam; how then?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Then his good report should have been my son; I

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: therein would have found issue. Hear me profess

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: sincerely: had I a dozen sons, each in my love

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: alike and none less dear than thine and my good

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Marcius, I had rather had eleven die nobly for their

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: country than one voluptuously surfeit out of action.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Enter a Gentlewoman

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Madam, the Lady Valeria is come to visit you.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: Beseech you, give me leave to retire myself.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Indeed, you shall not.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Methinks I hear hither your husband's drum,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: See him pluck Aufidius down by the hair,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: As children from a bear, the Volsces shunning him:

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Methinks I see him stamp thus, and call thus:

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: 'Come on, you cowards! you were got in fear,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Though you were born in Rome:' his bloody brow

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: With his mail'd hand then wiping, forth he goes,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Like to a harvest-man that's task'd to mow

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Or all or lose his hire.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: His bloody brow! O Jupiter, no blood!

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Away, you fool! it more becomes a man

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Than gilt his trophy: the breasts of Hecuba,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: When she did suckle Hector, look'd not lovelier

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Than Hector's forehead when it spit forth blood

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: At Grecian sword, contemning. Tell Valeria,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: We are fit to bid her welcome.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Exit Gentlewoman

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: Heavens bless my lord from fell Aufidius!

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: He'll beat Aufidius 'head below his knee

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: And tread upon his neck.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Enter VALERIA, with an Usher and Gentlewoman

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: My ladies both, good day to you.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Sweet madam.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: I am glad to see your ladyship.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: How do you both? you are manifest house-keepers.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: What are you sewing here? A fine spot, in good

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: faith. How does your little son?

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: I thank your ladyship; well, good madam.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: He had rather see the swords, and hear a drum, than

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: look upon his school-master.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: O' my word, the father's son: I'll swear,'tis a

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: very pretty boy. O' my troth, I looked upon him o'

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Wednesday half an hour together: has such a

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: confirmed countenance. I saw him run after a gilded

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: butterfly: and when he caught it, he let it go

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: again; and after it again; and over and over he

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: comes, and again; catched it again; or whether his

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: fall enraged him, or how 'twas, he did so set his

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: teeth and tear it; O, I warrant it, how he mammocked

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: it!

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: One on 's father's moods.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Indeed, la, 'tis a noble child.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: A crack, madam.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Come, lay aside your stitchery; I must have you play

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: the idle husewife with me this afternoon.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: No, good madam; I will not out of doors.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Not out of doors!

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: She shall, she shall.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: Indeed, no, by your patience; I'll not over the

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: threshold till my lord return from the wars.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Fie, you confine yourself most unreasonably: come,

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: you must go visit the good lady that lies in.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: I will wish her speedy strength, and visit her with

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: my prayers; but I cannot go thither.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Why, I pray you?

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: 'Tis not to save labour, nor that I want love.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: You would be another Penelope: yet, they say, all

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: the yarn she spun in Ulysses' absence did but fill

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Ithaca full of moths. Come; I would your cambric

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: were sensible as your finger, that you might leave

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: pricking it for pity. Come, you shall go with us.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: No, good madam, pardon me; indeed, I will not forth.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: In truth, la, go with me; and I'll tell you

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: excellent news of your husband.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: O, good madam, there can be none yet.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Verily, I do not jest with you; there came news from

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: him last night.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: Indeed, madam?

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: In earnest, it's true; I heard a senator speak it.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Thus it is: the Volsces have an army forth; against

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: whom Cominius the general is gone, with one part of

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: our Roman power: your lord and Titus Lartius are set

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: down before their city Corioli; they nothing doubt

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: prevailing and to make it brief wars. This is true,

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: on mine honour; and so, I pray, go with us.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: Give me excuse, good madam; I will obey you in every

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: thing hereafter.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Let her alone, lady: as she is now, she will but

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: disease our better mirth.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: In troth, I think she would. Fare you well, then.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Come, good sweet lady. Prithee, Virgilia, turn thy

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: solemness out o' door. and go along with us.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: No, at a word, madam; indeed, I must not. I wish

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: you much mirth.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Well, then, farewell.

speaker: VALERIA
text_entry: Exeunt
